intro: Chorizanthe floccosa, commonly known as the woolly chori, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pink to reddish bracts. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Chorizanthe floccosa is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
